document_title: Security update for the Linux Kernel RT (Live Patch 0 for SLE 15 SP6)

document_notes.text: Security update for the Linux Kernel RT (Live Patch 0 for SLE 15 SP6)
document_notes.title: Topic

document_notes.text:
This update for the Linux Kernel 6.4.0-150600_8 fixes one issue.

The following security issue was fixed:

- CVE-2024-50264: vsock/virtio: Initialization of the dangling pointer occurring in vsk->trans (bsc#1233712).
document_notes.title: Details

notes.text:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:

vsock/virtio: Initialization of the dangling pointer occurring in vsk->trans

During loopback communication, a dangling pointer can be created in
vsk->trans, potentially leading to a Use-After-Free condition.  This
issue is resolved by initializing vsk->trans to NULL.
notes.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text: To install this SUSE Security Update use the SUSE recommended installation methods like YaST online_update or "zypper patch".
